title: Epstein case put former minister Jack Lang under investigation and his Arab World Institute presidency at risk
subhead: France's national financial prosecutor's office announced on Friday, February 6, that it had opened an investigation into 'aggravated money laundering of tax fraud' targeting the Arab World Institute's president, Jack Lang, and his daughter Caroline.

title: Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
2026 Olympics Figure Skating: Russia ban opens up team event like never before
The Netherlands learns a lesson on right and far-right alliances
subhead: Seven out of the 26 members of the parliamentary group of the Party for Freedom (PVV) defected on January 20, criticizing their leader for a lack of internal democracy. The far-right party, which was part of the governing coalition in 2024 and 2025, is now only the fourth-largest group in the Dutch House of Representatives.

title: In Syria's Roj detention camp, jihadist women are convinced they will soon be 'freed'
subhead: The female prisoners, mostly foreign nationals who joined the Islamic State group in the 2010s, celebrate the advance of Syrian government forces, who are set to retake control of the camps and prisons in the Kurdish autonomous region under the January 30 agreement.

title: Glitz, opera and alpine spectacle mark opening of Milan-Cortina Olympics
subhead: Athletes paraded across multiple Alpine venues as organizers launched the most geographically dispersed Games in Olympic history, while Lindsey Vonn's injury-defying comeback drew early attention. Celebrations in Milan unfolded alongside protests over the presence of US immigration agents supporting the American delegation.

title: Julian Barnes bids farewell: 'There's no such thing as a perfect novel'
subhead: The British writer has published what he says will be his final book, 'Departure(s)', as he celebrates his 80th birthday. He welcomed Le Monde into his home in London for a wide-ranging conversation on his career as a writer and his body of work.

title: Danone recalls batches of infant formula in Britain, Spain, Croatia and Slovenia over potential toxin
Islamic State claims responsibility for attack on Shiite mosque that killed at least 31 in Pakistan
Iran anticipates more negotiations with the US, citing a 'positive atmosphere' during talks in Oman

EU tells TikTok to change its 'addictive' design or face fines
France warns of possible 'IS resurgence' in Syria, where 'French citizens' security is also at stake'
Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
subhead: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

title: 'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhead: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

title: European intelligence services adapt to the upheavals of the Trump era
subhead: Shaken by Donald Trump's unpredictable behavior, European intelligence services, long reliant on the United States, are tightening their cooperation.

title: Epstein scandal tarnishes former minister Jack Lang and France's image
'Not only is Trump not crazy, but he is dangerous': Historian Laure Murat salutes Minneapolis 'lesson in democracy'
'The Kurds had Western support, especially from the US. That support has now been withdrawn'
